programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack's not having much luck with lights these days, whether it's the fizzling sign at the start of this show, the blackout during his recent Sheffield gig, or the dimly lit area at the start of this seventh series. Lee and Lucy have enjoyed a spot of culture at their local cinema, but the sparkle of a French movie is soon diminished when the romantic walk home finds them in an imposing underpass. She has her handbag stolen by a bunch of cocky youths from under his nose. Given the fact the layabout failed to protect her, or come up with an accurate description of their muggers, Lee feels the urge to prove his manliness, but will a spell at the local boxing ring be a help or a hindrance? programme.title: Not Going Out

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: War Factories

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.desc: Eric and Ernie's first work in colour on American television and an appearance alongside the likes of Bing Crosby and Bob Hope prompts a move to the BBC back home, following a disappointing end to their time at ATV. Featuring interview testimony from many who knew and worked with Morecambe and Wise, and their many famous fans, including Penn & Teller, Shappi Khorsandi, Steve Punt, Gina Yashere and Stephen K Amos. Presented by Jonathan Ross.

programme.desc: While driving a borrowed armoured car, Rene and Captain Geering are mistaken for an ammunition convoy and ambushed by the Resistance, giving Monsieur Alfonse the ideal opportunity to woo Edith. Comedy, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Monsieur Alphonse and Rene decide to duel with pistols to determine who should win Edith's hand, while Hitler orders the Colonel's arrest.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

Drama, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman. Presenter Nicholas Day reveals how he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

Treasures brought in to be valued include a harp that survived the French Revolution, a curious wooden item with an unexpected purpose, a diamond brooch found hidden inside a barometer and a pair of Second World War propaganda posters printed on hessian sacking.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the startling similarities between humans and great apes, meeting an orang-utan able to row boats and wash clothes and a gorilla that can communicate using sign language. programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. Starting in Pitlochry, he traverses the Killiecrankie Pass, where the Jacobites won the Battle of Killiecrankie, and ends his trek at Balmoral and the fantasy castle Albert built as his and Victoria's Highland escape.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The stories of famous hoaxes, featuring personal accounts of those who perpetrated and exposed them, beginning with the infamous alien autopsy footage.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist continues to explore the secrets behind evolution, this time focusing on the animal kingdom's bizarre hybrids, including the 'pizzly bear', a cross between a polar bear and a grizzly, which is thought to have come into being as a result of global warming. He also covers the killer bee brought into existence due to the transfer of African bees to South America.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Footage of animals that have unusual means of finding their way around. Dung beetles are able to navigate by the sky, using the position of the sun, moon and stars to determine which is the right direction to go in, while pigeons display remarkable powers of memory, able to recall complex travel routes and follow manmade roads and hedgerows.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The first of three programmes about the wildlife, landscape and culture in different areas of the country explores the Sierra Madre mountains, and reveals how this rugged landscape has shaped the nation. This chain of peaks includes several volcanoes and is home to a wide variety of animals, including black bears, monarch butterflies, orchid bees and quetzals. The programme also visits the ruins of an ancient Aztec shrine and the blue agave plant which grows in the mountains is used in making tequila.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: Exploring the forests of the Yucatan Peninsula, which contain the ruins of the Mayan civilisation and a wide range of wildlife, including jaguars, monkeys and tropical birds. The region also holds a secret that is the key to how Mexico's people and animals are able to survive during the country's dry season.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The series concludes by exploring the north of the country, which is dominated by two deserts - the Sonoran and the Chihuahuan. The programme explores the conditions that have shaped this environment, and reveals how animals including prairie dogs, pygmy owls and aplomado falcons have adapted to thrive in these arid conditions.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of marine life in different environments around the north, beginning with a tropical coral reef which has medicinal properties for dolphins, and is used as a tool by tusk fish. In Japan, a shipwreck is home to the Asian sheepshead wrasse, which can change gender, while in the polar north, walruses struggle to find ice floes for their pups to rest on as climate change takes its toll on the environment.

programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is under pressure to keep his promise to burn down Frank's Autos, but Frank's plans don't go according to plan.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A car crash leads to an unusual rescue for the squad. Meanwhile, Nick gets a surprise when he returns home. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack's mountain rescue skills are put to the test when a kidney transplant patient is lost during a storm. Back at the practice, Will tries to deal with his personal problems. Kevin Whately, Amanda Burton and Simon Shepherd star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Denise Van Outen joins the cast as new district nurse Kim, a single parent with a shady past who doesn't take kindly to anyone prying into her affairs. Beth begins to have second thoughts as she and Tom prepare to leave the village, especially when friend Hattie reveals she has terminal cancer, and Ozias Harding takes up the reins at the factory once more. Prunella Scales guest stars.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey decides to make an effort with her in-laws for Darryl's sake - but soon lives to regret it. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy. The death of her husband leaves upper-class snob Audrey fforbes-Hamilton a widow in drastically reduced circumstances, with her beloved ancestral pile up for auction. Starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour vows that the days of Edie having to carry a dustbin are over, and promises to install a waste disposal unit for her. Meanwhile, a former wartime comrade of Wally's makes an appearance. Michael Aldridge, Thora Hird and Joe Gladwin star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Having witnessed his sister Edie fail several driving tests, Seymour gallantly volunteers to help teach her. However, because he is unable to control a vehicle himself, he needs a qualified motorist to ride along. Michael Aldridge and Thora Hird star.

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Celebrity portrait painter Agatha Troy asks Alleyn to investigate the death of a venerable Shakespearean actor whose portrait she had been commissioned to paint. Drama, starring Patrick Malahide, with Belinda Lang.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sasha is forced to work with her ex-husband Ned Hancock when their teams investigate the death of film critic Oliver Houghton, whose body was discovered floating in the Thames. UCOS delves into the victim's past and explores his link to the murder of a conceptual artist 20 years previously, while Hancock's knowledge of London's hidden past proves invaluable when a piece of occult footage from the 1970s plunges the investigators into the macabre world of human sacrifice. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance by Barnaby Kay.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is asked to help the police investigate the case of two brothers found dead in a police cell - but subsequent developments force her to confront the unpalatable truth about her involvement in a murder inquiry 13 years previously.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A car crash leads to an unusual rescue for the squad. Meanwhile, Nick gets a surprise when he returns home. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Brad Connor is devastated to learn he may be HIV positive, and makes a drunken pass at Marsha Stubbs. Joy Wilton discovers the joys of mixing work with pleasure.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy is forced to face his fear of heights head-on, and Army widow Joy Wilton gets a second chance at happiness, while Michael and Marsha's marriage shows further signs of crumbling. Starring Ben Nealon, Rob Spendlove, Denise Welch and Meera Syal.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tricia is rushed back to the hospital after the crash, but Mark's return is delayed when he fails a breath test and finds himself accused of drink-driving. Once out of the police station, he returns to Holby - where horrifying news awaits him. Sam turns detective to discover the truth about Jade's medical background, and Lola almost catches Matt and Nikki in a passionate clinch.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A drug user's angry mother refuses to be pacified and directs her fury at Max. Charlie embarks on a course of action in a bid to win back his son, and Holly receives flowers from a secret admirer. Meanwhile, the paramedics rush to a remote cottage where a boy has been knocked unconscious. Medical drama, starring Robert Gwilym and Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil receives some devastating news from Kathy. Frank faces up to an unpleasant reality. Shelley gets caught up in a Fowler feud, and Mark discovers he has a fairy godmother.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard decides to seek out his secret admirer, while Cindy is confused by Ian's behaviour.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to rescue a familiar face, and a collapsing building traps an elderly woman. Starring Andrew Kazamia and Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack struggles to save an asthmatic schoolgirl's life when her mother will only resort to faith healing. Meanwhile, Will has survived his breakdown and is eager to go back to work, determined he and Sarah will resolve their problems. Drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Stubborn postmistress Evie does her best to make Kim feel unwelcome, but a secret from her past soon explains the shopkeeper's icy attitude. Billy is shocked when he gets the job at the factory, David and Megan come to terms with their news, and Nathan lands himself in trouble. Drama, guest starring Elaine Paige.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon tries to make the best of her job at the bakery and Dorien joins the Open University, while Tracey continues to study at the school of hard knocks. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey moves out of Grantleigh Manor, and Richard and his mother move in, disappointing the former resident with their new ways. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour comes up with another madcap scheme to harness the power of nature using an old sail, a pair of roller skates and, in Compo, a very gullible 'test pilot'. Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: When You Take a Good Bite, Yorkshire Tastes Terrible
programme.desc: When Clegg receives news of an old friend dying in America, Compo and Seymour join him on a journey down memory lane, recalling time spent at school walking on gates and climbing trees - forgetting, of course, that it was many years ago. Poignant instalament of the long-running comedy, featuring the final appearance of Joe Gladwin as Wally Batty.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate mysterious goings-on when a woman dies after being picked from the audience to assist a magician in a stage trick.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A local journalist tries to convince the people of Lighthaven there is a big cat on the moors, but nobody will believe him - until the discovery of his mauled body.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a Roman sword with traces of blood on it is linked to an unidentified, headless corpse found near Heathrow in March 2008. It leads the team members to a lock-up belonging to a bodybuilder called Mark Rix, who died of a suspected heart attack the same year, so they start looking for connections between the original murder and Rix's death. They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Tracy-Ann Obermann and Liz White guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Sam is not convinced a sports agent committed suicide, after a post-mortem reveals she was in the early stages of pregnancy and bruising to her arms suggests a sexual assault. Matters are complicated further when a client she was planning a new life with is found dead in her flat and tests reveal the father of her baby is Caucasian, putting her husband back in the frame, despite his alibi.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to rescue a familiar face, and a collapsing building traps an elderly woman. Starring Andrew Kazamia and Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Peggy attends a district nurses' conference in Scarborough, where she surprises everyone - including herself - with her instinctive knack for public speaking. Ruth, who's also along for the trip, spends the night at a former boyfriend's flat - but returns to Skelthwaite with a clear conscience. Drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Walter soon feels the heat when he manages to set his flat on fire, Simon clashes with Ruth over her commitment to the job and Peggy finally reaches an understanding with her son Stephen.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Left to look after Felsham Hall until it has been sold, Lovejoy uses the house as a furniture showroom. It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is threatened by a debt collector over a long outstanding sum and his hopes of meeting the repayment rest on a silver tankard, and hijacking a local auction administered by Charlotte Cavendish to obtain an antique piece of Japanese pottery. Meanwhile, newcomer Beth Taylor gives Eric and Tinker a helping hand. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Having finally recovered from the death of his beloved Teresa, Sharpe marries Jane Gibbons. Before the honeymoon is over, he is forced to rush off and capture a fort behind French lines - and while he is away a fever outbreak threatens to cut short his new marriage. Sean Bean stars.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Pru from the Embassy visits Barry in jail and reassures the gang they are doing everything they can to free him - but the Cubans have discovered his Russian connections and convinced themselves he is a spy. Neville feels the pressure as he is forced to home in on his target, and Oz faces a major setback in his relationship with Ofelia. Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Kevin Whately star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A terrified Neville is kidnapped, driven through the back streets of Havana and deposited at an empty house - where he is greeted by Pru from the Embassy, who asks him to trap rogue operative Tarquin. Meanwhile, there is still no sign of Barry being released from jail, and his deteriorating condition prompts Oz to make a heartbreaking decision. Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate mysterious goings-on when a woman dies after being picked from the audience to assist a magician in a stage trick.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan star as chalk-and-cheese detectives determined to find the killer of a once-promising rugby player's wife. Clues point to the husband - but the duo suspect it could be part of a conspiracy. Adapted by Alan Plater from Reginald Hill's award-winning crime novels, with Ralph Brown and Susannah Corbett.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: A couple stumble upon the body of an elderly man in the old hospital wing of an abandoned mental health facility, strapped to a gurney with electrodes connected to his temples.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the poisoning of a former hangman, while romance is in the air for Mrs McCarthy. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A serial arsonist targets sites related to the 1983 general election. After risking his life in a burning building following a quiet word from Keats, Ray gets personally involved in the high-profile investigation - which forces him to face his traumatic past as it becomes clear the tragic events of the Falklands War are driving the firestarter to murder. Fantasy drama, with Dean Andrews and Joe Absolom (Doc Martin).

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene jeopardises a covert operation into a drug cartel when he learns several dealers have been murdered recently and the crimes are linked to an old adversary. Chris falls for the attractive undercover officer, but his feelings prompt a violent outburst that threatens his future in the police, and Alex gathers more clues about why she remains in the 1980s. With guest star Zoe Telford (Criminal Justice).

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of 10 giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to £10,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: When Magoo treats Mr Cat to a parachute jump, the two friends land on the top of the AeroFizz. Mr Magoo mistakes it for a desert island!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Weasel (in an animal costume) for a groundhog being hunted, and confiscates the hunter's gun..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz is at the pool, he wants to start sub-marine hairdressing! But Magoo, thinks he is fishing in a lake, and starts trying to catch Weasel..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike's owner buys him a pair of cute new shoes for his paws. Mike isn't pleased by the new footwear at all and they make some seriously awful squeaking noises.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons break into the Mikkelsens house again and Mike is easily defeated during a fight against the determined crooks.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean plans a romantic meal with his girlfriend, only to fall asleep while the main course is in the oven. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean is forced to retrieve a tennis ball from the roof of a house across the road, but gets paralysed by vertigo 60ft up and has to rely on a hamster to steer him to safety. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: A mysterious electrical storm downs the Omni-Copter.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Troublesome Treachery of The...
programme.desc: The boys face off against the Toot Fairy while trying to get Mr Krupp fired..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave gets a girlfriend who turns out to be an alien. And she turns out to bear a striking similarity to an everyday household item..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Anna is practising for the school cycling test and is good at it. Dave isn't quite as skilled, but with a new bike from his parents he really hopes to pass..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Michelin-starred chef Lisa Goodwin-Allen on a visit to the Isle of Man during the warm-up week for the famous TT race. James serves up proper biker food - pork burgers with a spicy apple sauce - and picks up some local Manx kippers to make soup. Lisa visits local organic juice producers before James joins TT legend John McGuinness as he and his team prepare for the race, treating the bikers to lamb chops with hispi cabbage and an olive glaze.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Nurse Maggie Simkiss cares for end of life patients and treats their emotional well-being as well as their direct medical needs. To say thank you for her hard work, Alan Titchmarsh and his team of green-fingered experts arrive at her Hull home and help transform the unkempt garden into a grown-up Mediterranean hideaway.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Advice on growing fruit and vegetables, with Alan sharing the tips and tricks he uses on his own plot, with his Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney joining in from their homes. From seriously stylish ways to grow veg anywhere to practical tips on what to plant and where, they show how to get gardens bursting with fruit, salad, herbs and vegetables to supply the table for the year ahead and beyond.

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.sub-title: The Good, The Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: Martin learns about animal exploitation - the good, the bad and the ugly. The actor visits Sri Lanka, where fishing for manta rays is legal, but a turtle sanctuary offers hope. In Thailand, he learns more about silk production - as well as a more animal-friendly alternative - and on the Australian Friday Island, he is shown the delicate art of growing pearls. Finally, in the Abrolhos islands, Martin learns about the most valuable catch in Australia's waters.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle attends the annual Ennerdale Show in the Lake District, where he takes part in some sheep-showing and gets to grips with some Cumbrian wrestling, while Liz Bonnin heads to the River Nith in south-west Scotland for a training day with the river rescue team. Guest reporter Sheila Hancock returns to the quiet corner of the Dorset coast where she first fell in love with the countryside almost 80 years ago.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty presents as eight celebrity families take part in this knockout tournament, hoping to win £25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The first episode is a battle of the soaps, as Coronation Street's Lucy Fallon (Bethany Platt) and her family take on former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson (Barry Evans) and his clan. Two new rounds have been added to this celebrity spin on the format - including an Observation round featuring cartoon images of Anne that put their memories to the test.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian takes a trip down memory lane as he presents a series of classic TV game shows, which have all been updated with a new final round offering the contestants a chance to win big. The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. The hopefuls are daytime stalwarts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, comedian Chris Ramsey and his wife Rosie, presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia, and singer-actress Martine McCutcheon and her husband Jack McManus.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park (1997)
programme.desc: Scientist Dr Ian Malcolm reluctantly joins a research team on the island where his employer first designed genetically engineered dinosaurs. Meanwhile, a big-game hunter takes the chance to bag the biggest prize of all - a Tyrannosaurus rex. Steven Spielberg's dinosaur adventure sequel, starring Jeff Goldblum, Julianne Moore, Pete Postlethwaite and Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Adam Garcia, Carol Decker, Holly Walsh and Rylan Clark-Neal pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)
programme.desc: British author Newt Scamander arrives in 1920s New York with a bagful of magical creatures as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but gets caught up in a conflict when some of the creatures in his care are accidentally released. With a strange dark force terrorising the city, Newt needs to find some allies to help him round-up the beasts, while saving his own skin in the meantime. Harry Potter prequel, starring Eddie Redmayne, Katherine Waterston and Colin Farrell.

programme.title: Die Another Day (2002)
programme.desc: James Bond is suspended from duty after being taken hostage in North Korea, but goes against orders to track down those who betrayed him. During the pursuit of the terrorist he was investigating before his capture, he discovers a connection with a British billionaire who has constructed a devastating orbital weapon. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Halle Berry, Toby Stephens, Judi Dench and John Cleese.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai

For their final stop in the city, the boys meet 85-year-old Norma Otter, who was a team-mate of Dougie's international hockey star aunt, Pansy Thomas. Following the meeting, the boys decide to take on a junior girl's hockey team who are training nearby. As their adventure draws to a close, the family arrive in Jejuri in the midst of the 100,000 festival goers who are there to take part in what is known as the Golden Festival.

Starring Brenda Blethyn, with David Leon, Sonya Cassidy, Jon Morrison and Eva Birthistle.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: In Northern Ireland, James and local boy Paul Rankin brave the Carrick-a-Rede rope bridge together, then James cooks a tasty fish dish with the dramatic coastline as his backdrop. There's a fishing trip over to Rathlin Island on the menu too, where James tastes some dishes made from the local kelp. The duo then visit the Old Lammas Fair, where they taste some of the delicious seafood, before James cooks up a delicious boozy sweet treat using some of Ireland's tastiest liquor.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle tries his hand at free diving in Cornwall and Liz Bonnin works with a team of volunteers at Cuan Wildlife Rescue centre in Shropshire caring for injured birds. Lesley Joseph indulges her love of stately homes as she turns guide for the day at Osterley Park in Middlesex and John Whaite travels back home to Lancashire and the family farm he grew up on to cook up some Eccles cakes.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Coventry in Warwickshire is host to David Dickinson and his dealers. Henry Nicholls turns detective, Fay Rutter bags a Breitling watch, and Alison Chapman is in a fluster with some coins - and their charming seller.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: Euro 96 England v Netherlands - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces action from the memorable Group A match, which came from Wembley Stadium. Bob Wilson presented the coverage, with analysis from John Barnes and Jack Charlton, and commentary by Brian Moore and Kevin Keegan.

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: A chance to catch the original US version of the show in which mystery celebrities battle it out in a singing contest while dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes, while a panel of more famous faces tries to guess their identities. Nick Cannon oversees the contest, as mystery singers dressed as Butterfly, Egg, Thingamajig and Skeleton take to the stage, while panellists Robin Thicke, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger, and regular star of the British spin-off Ken Jeong try to work out who is behind the mask.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK

Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: James Bond achieves his '00' status and is dispatched on the trail of Le Chiffre, an international criminal financing terrorist organisations around the world. Bond's investigation leads to a casino in Montenegro, where he takes part in a high-stakes poker game in a bid to bankrupt Le Chiffre and put an end to his plans. Spy thriller, directed by Martin Campbell and starring Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007, with Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench and Giancarlo Giannini.
